commands.name: az eventgrid namespace create
commands.syntax:
az eventgrid namespace create --name
                              --resource-group
                              [--identity]
                              [--inbound-ip-rules]
                              [--is-zone-redundant {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--location]
                              [--minimum-tls-version-allowed {1.0, 1.1, 1.2}]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--private-endpoint-connections]
                              [--public-network-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                              [--sku]
                              [--tags]
                              [--topic-spaces-configuration]
examples: az eventgrid namespace create -g rg -n namespace

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace delete
commands.syntax:
az eventgrid namespace delete [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--yes]
examples: az eventgrid namespace delete -g rg -n namespace

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace list
commands.summary: List all the namespaces under an Azure subscription.

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace list-key
commands.summary: List the two keys used to publish to a namespace.
examples: az eventgrid namespace list-key -g rg --namespace-name name

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace regenerate-key
commands.summary: Regenerate a shared access key for a namespace.
commands.syntax:
az eventgrid namespace regenerate-key --key-name
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--namespace-name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
examples: az eventgrid namespace regenerate-key -g rg --namespace-name name --key-name key1

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace show
examples: az eventgrid namespace show -g rg -n namespace

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace update
commands.syntax:
az eventgrid namespace update [--identity]
                              [--ids]
                              [--inbound-ip-rules]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--public-network-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--sku]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--tags]
                              [--topic-spaces-configuration]
examples: az eventgrid namespace update -g rg -n namespoace --tags "{tag:test}" --sku "{name:standard,capacity:2}" --topic-spaces-configuration "{maximumSessionExpiryInHours:1}"

commands.name: az eventgrid namespace wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
